instructions: Choose a location for your Nest Wifi router. Your router will need to be connected to a working modem that is connected to the Internet. For the strongest signal, place your router at eye level, in plain view, like on a shelf or TV stand. Learn more about where to place your router . On your Google Wifi primary point, disconnect the Ethernet cable from the WAN port then connect the Ethernet cable to your Nest Wifi router s WAN port . The cable should now be connected between your Google Nest Wifi router s WAN port and your modem. Plug your Nest Wifi router into a power outlet. After about a minute, the light will pulse white to indicate that it s on and ready for setup. On your phone or tablet, open the Google Home app . Tap Add and then Set up device. Under New devices, tap Set up new devices in your home. Choose a home. Select your Nest Wifi router. Choose Create new network. Scan the QR code on the bottom of your device. Hold your phone about 5 inches (12 cm) away to scan. Learn more tips for scanning QR codes. If you re unable to scan the QR code, tap Continue without scanning , then enter the setup key on the bottom of your device. Select a room for your router or create a new one. Give your Wi-Fi network a name and a secure password. The router will now create your Wi-Fi network. This may take a few minutes. If you re ready to add your Google Wifi device or an additional Nest Wifi device to this new network, tap Yes to continue in the app, or else follow the steps below to add a point at a later time.

Open the Google Home app . Add and then Set up device. Under New devices, tap Set up new devices in your home. If prompted, choose a home. Select a Google Wifi point that you ve factory reset and then Next . Scan the QR code on the bottom of your device. Hold your phone about 5 inches (12 cm) away to scan. More tips for scanning QR codes. If you re unable to scan the QR code, tap Continue without scanning, then enter the setup key on the bottom of your device. Your point will now connect. Follow the in-app instructions to finish set up. If you d like to add another point, tap Yes in the app when prompted or repeat these steps at a later time for additional points. Once you ve added all of your Wifi devices, the app will perform a mesh test to confirm everything is working.

Download the Google Home app . If this is your first time using the Google Home app, set up a home . Choose a location for your Nest Wifi router. For the strongest signal, place your device at eye level, in plain view, like on a shelf or TV stand. Learn more about where to place your Wifi points . Plug your Nest Wifi router into a power outlet. After about a minute, the light will pulse white to indicate that it s on and ready for setup. On your phone or tablet, open the Google Home app . Tap Add Set up device. Under New devices, tap Set up new devices in your home. Choose a home. Select your Nest Wifi router. Choose Add to existing. If prompted, select the existing Wi-Fi network you want to add your Nest Wifi router to. Tap Next to add your Google Wifi device and settings to the Google Home app. Scan the QR code on the bottom of your Nest Wifi router. Hold your phone about 5 inches (12 cm) away to scan. Learn more tips for scanning QR codes. If you re unable to scan the QR code, tap Continue without scanning , then enter the setup key on the bottom of your device. Follow the instructions in the app to complete setup. If you d like to add another Wifi device, tap Yes in the app to continue and follow the steps to set up a Google Nest Wifi point .

Choose a location for your Nest Wifi point. For the strongest signal, place your device at eye level, in plain view, like on a shelf or TV stand. This should also be a room in which you want to interact with the Google Assistant. Learn more about where to place your Wifi points . Plug your Nest Wifi point into a power outlet. Download the Google Home app . If this is your first time using the Google Home app, set up a home . On your phone or tablet, open the Google Home app . Tap Add Set up device. Under New devices, tap Set up new devices in your home. Choose a home. Select your Nest Wifi point. Choose Add to existing. If prompted, select the existing Wi-Fi network you want to add your Nest Wifi router to. Tap Next to add your Google Wifi device and settings to the Google Home app. Scan the QR code on the bottom of your device. Hold your phone about 5 inches (12 cm) away to scan. More tips for scanning QR codes. If you re unable to scan the QR code, tap Continue without scanning, then enter the setup key on the bottom of your device. Your point will now connect. When you hear a sound from your speaker, tap Yes . Follow the in-app instructions to finish set up. If you d like to add another point, tap Yes in the app when prompted or repeat these steps at a later time for additional points. Once you ve added all of your Wifi devices, the app will perform a mesh test to confirm everything is working.
